title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: They called to schedule an interview and didn’t call back on the day they said they were. Then another person called on a day I was busy and was not a pleasant interviewer. Would not recommend here at all, wasted my time.
Interview Questions: Do you have your high school diploma?

title: Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Marshfield, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Director and Camp Director of the Club and enjoyed talking with both of them about my work over the summer and what tasks I will be doing
Interview Questions: My availability for starting work

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Strawberry Plains, TN) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very casual interview with the director. She just asked questions about myself and how I would handle many different situations with the members/students. The questions were more or less common sense questions and she made me feel me feel very comfortable.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw a child treating another child badly?

title: Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Director is unorganized, and did not see enthusiastic about doing the interview. Also experience ageism during the interview, hinting at how young I appeared and doubting I can handle working with older employees.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, asked a lot of scenario questions. Like what would you do in certain situations. Asked about your experience and why you want to work for boys and girls club.
Interview Questions: What is one activity that you would plan that includes our core areas?

title: Client Success Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with head of the department. Straightforward interview. Interviewer was prepared with questions. Received no followup. Never received feedback or email after my interview. Had to log in to their site to confirm that I was not selected.
Interview Questions: Why would I be the best candidate for this position

title: Youth Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Central, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was a thorough and well thought out phone interview . I felt like I was clearly speaking with professionals who care about the program. I am required to add six to eight more words by Glass Door but really I have nothing more to say of value.
Interview Questions: How would one deal with behavior issues? How would one increase participation? How flexible are you re duties and hours? Any scheduling conflicts?

title: Development Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: 5 month process culminating in a panel interview with Board members. Past board member president, current board president, CEO. No staff members at all. No community members or committee members
Interview Questions: Mostly conversational nothing specific about development

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Bellevue, WA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a short phone interview with an HR specialist. There were a few brief questions about my interest in working with the organization. Was immediately offered a second interview. Second interview was held with two directors. It was a bit more in depth.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: Youth Development Professional (YDP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were only a few questions asked and they were common sense. Just answer reasonably and you should be okay. They may try to move you to a different job then the one you originally applied for, however. So be prepared for them to suggest a different site for you to work at.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a crying child?

title: Site Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer commented that I may not be fit for the position because of how young I look, despite me being overly qualified due to my education and work experience. I felt discriminated against.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest problem impacting youth today?

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: first initial phone screen to go over resume. followed by Interview with direct supervisor whom was unaware and was late. Also, showed up dressed in pajamas. throughout the process, interview was rescheduled a few times. Third interview with senior management. final interview with ceo. whole process was messy and unorganized and I felt that my time was not respected.
Interview Questions: What is something you dislike about being an administrative assistant?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy process. I was asked about 6-7 questions about difficult client interactions, how you stay organized, and what you expect from your supervisor. It did take a week or two to get a response back from the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from your supervisor?

title: Program Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going, importance of kids Street, handling things professionally, being able to multitask, being able to handle a group of twenty to thirty kids at once. Positive attitude and helpful demeanor.
Interview Questions: What would you do in an emergency

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: It was smooth and simple, it was a 10 minute phone interview and then if you get accepted, you get an actual interview. The person on the phone was really nice and assisted me with any questions I had
Interview Questions: Why are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: After you fill out application, the director should contact directly to set up an interview. Easy interview with club director and assistant director. They only ask you five questions regarding your experience with kids.
Interview Questions: Explain you experience with kids?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Because I was not in town, I did a phone interview (which they were very happy to accommodate me with). They called 15 minutes early and it went for about 15 minutes. Very straightforward and they answered any questions I had for them happily
Interview Questions: What interests you about the Boys and Girls Club of America?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone interview and then a zoom interview two weeks later. They ghosted me after the zoom interview. I emailed to follow up a week later and they never responded. Not a good look
Interview Questions: Do you remember a time where you had to do a task repeatedly? How did you feel?

title: Youth Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview easy questions. Not hard mostly personal things and questions about what you would do in certain situations. Lots of paper work to fill out if you were offered the position
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child ran off from the group

title: Activity Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: It was not hard. Simple questions to answer. Just answer the questions the best you could and be honest. They ask you to tell them about yourself and other questions to why you want to work for them.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself was one of the questions

title: Human Resources/Volunteer Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Reno, NV)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an intermediate level of difficulty. There were two rounds, if I recall. The second round was a group panel style of interview with about 5 interviewers, all members of the senior management team.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about a heavy workload?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It took forever to get hired and they don’t communicate with you throughout the whole processes. It’s just waiting, and waiting. It’s been 3 months and i’m already starting another job!
Interview Questions: N/Aaaaa a a a a a

title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview regarding the CEO position for the local chapter. The interviewer called on the phone, and it was an HR representative. This was a screening initial interview. It was well organized overall.
Interview Questions: Asked about my prior experience

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was led to believe that I was going to be offered this job, interview went very well, but then told first thing the next morning that they weren't going to continue my hiring process. I asked for any feedback they have for me as I continue my job search and the director who interviewed me ghosted me.
Interview Questions:
What experience do you have?
How do you do in a fast-paced environment?
Can you deal with a 12-8 schedule?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. The first one was getting to know you and the second had more scenario questions. The first interview was with one of the team members and the second interview was with the direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: Question - tell me about yourself.

title: Program Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Nice. Easy flowing. The process felt genuine and like everyone I spoke to really cared about the program and what it stands for. They answered my questions professionally and informed me that it was a job that can be turned into a career.
Interview Questions: What club do you feel like you can implement in your programs school site?

title: Vice President of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews at an outdoor coffee cafe. Each interview was about two months apart. One panel interview with two Board Members. This interview was approximately six months after the first interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you think of our Club? Tell us about yourself. Most of the interview was spent listening to Club accomplishments and the makeup of the members.

title: After School Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions:
Asked about prior experience working with middle school aged children.  Was then asked about various scenarios with students ranging from upset actions to frustrating 
 actions and how would you handle the situation?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Corporate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I completed Four rounds of interview. I interviewed with two different people, separately.  then I was required to do an assignment and a final interview. The process took over one month.
Interview Questions: What is your last experience with kids

title: Data and Outcome Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews with large gaps of time in between. I had to reach out in order to hear from the hiring manager. The whole process was long and I never heard whether or not I got the position. The interview itself was professional and long, as it should be, but once completed, I was told I would hear back in 1-2 weeks. Never heard anything which I thought was very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What is a project that you oversaw from inception to completion?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was quick. I applied and received an interview date a couple days later. Interview lasted about an hour. We went over my experience and goals. and I was offered the position 2 days later.
Interview Questions: What are your experiences in project management.

title: Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I had one basic interview with HR. Everything seemed really positive but turns out I was completely ghosted and didn’t even receive a rejection email even when I know that role has been filled.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with writing for fundraising?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Winterville, NC) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was through microsoft teams. The second interview was at the Boys and Girls Club. They asked me what experience I had witb children. They asked me why I decided to work for the Boys and Girls Club.
Interview Questions: If more than one child gets upset, how would you deal with the situation?

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Started off with “get to know you” questions. Once they get a feel for who you are, the real interview questions start but if you’ve got passion for what the organization stands for, you’ll do just fine.
Interview Questions: What do you think you bring to Boy’s and Girl’s club that might not already exist?

title: Secretary/Aide Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Prescott Valley, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: It was fun and exciting. I got to hang out with some of the kids and they took to me right away. The staff really seemed nice and got along with me also. It was definitely by far the best interview Iv'e ever had.
Interview Questions:
Have you been or took care of children before?
Do you have experience in helping children with autism?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty easy. They are really only looking for someone who has experience or is knowledgable about working with kids. They are looking for someone outgoing and someone who also won't let the kids walk over you.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where two children are disagreeing on something?

title: Director of Philanthropy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Summitted resume and received an email within a few days to schedule a video interview with the hiring manager.  Interview was typical, said there would be second round interviews scheduled after the following week.  I logged into my applicant account and noted the status said "not selected" - but that update had not been shared with me otherwise.
Interview Questions: Asked about my experience coordinating stewardship and solicitation of donors between Annual Giving and Major Gifts, and other usual fundraising related questions.

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Coeur d'Alene, ID) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy flowing. It seemed a little rushed since the location was understaffed, so it felt the time spent doing the interview was time away from helping managing the staff and children within the club.
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to gain from working here?

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Panel style interview - interviewed by branch directors in need of the position. Questions vary about previous work with kids and the ability to be creative and think on your feet.
Interview Questions: Describe an activity for students that would be fun yet educational.

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly short and easy. Required to come up with an activity and describe it to the interviewer. Basic questions about keeping kids safe. Overall it was a very informal process and non-intimdating.
Interview Questions: What is classroom management to you?

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone. It was regular length. Maybe about 15 minutes. The interview isn't hard, just answer honestly and sound happy to work with kids. Make sure to ask a few questions at the end of the interview because that always helps you look better.
Interview Questions: How would you make a parent feel comfortable that you are watching their kids?

title: Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Pasco, WA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was first a call in screening process. They just wanted to know the basics. Some question were inquiring about vax statues and if you ever supervised children before. Then there was a group interview
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with children?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Johnson City, TN)
Interview Descriptions:
Kind, organized, easy, basic , friendly comfort
They have couple of questions, to know your personality more. And if you had worked with kids before. They ask you “ what would you do if one of the kids done sth.. etc”
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: awesome interview experience, super chill and friendly. Basic questions such as "what made you want to work with children" and "tell us about a time you had to work on a team with others" questions of that nature.
Interview Questions: what experience do you have working with children

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the human resources manager a few weeks after applying for the  position. Most of the interview centered around why I wanted to work at the company and what I could contribute as a new employee.
Interview Questions: Can you describe an instance in which you had to resolve a conflict with someone?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Washington, DC) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, polite, and understanding. There was great communication and they were able to answer all my questions. All interview question were very reasonable and it is clear they truly care about their mission. Very clear values that I wholeheartedly agree with.
Interview Questions: They asked me what my biggest challenge was and how I overcame it.

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The first interview process includes and not limited to you and two other club directors.  After you get the  job offer there will be A lot of training videos a d paperwork.
Interview Questions: My experience that I have with youth?

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Denver, CO) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Was initially pre-screened by HR Manager at BGC of Metro Denver over phone with him asking me if I would pass a drug screen. Then there were initially 3 rounds. 1st an interview, then a writing assignment, and the 3rd was the final with HR Director. After making it to the 3rd round, I was told, there was another round with Club Directors. The whole process became too drawn out and a red flag that they could not make a decision.
Interview Questions: The written assignment was "given what you know about Boys & Girls Clubs to write 1/2 page on  how you would describe our organization to a potential applicant to get them excited about working for us". There were also words they asked you to define in your own terms. (Teamwork, Flexibility). The interview questions had typical situational questions such as :tell me about a time you had a difficult situation with an employee and how you handled it.

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Springfield, MO) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very diligent in the questions she asked and kept it real about how the job is. Showed a passion for her work that inspired me also to want to work there.
Interview Questions: Are you good with children?

title: Child Care Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The person was friendly. Didn’t ask a lot about me. Gave me more information about the job. She said that I was qualified so she didn’t need to go into asking me a ton of questions.
Interview Questions: What is your degree in?

title: Unit Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Cheyenne, WY) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a message through indeed, had two interviews, and was extended an offer. Overall, it went pretty smoothly and they were very helpful. The HR director that took point on the interview process went out of their way to help me find housing locally.
Interview Questions: What is you greatest strength/weakness?

title: Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Killeen, TX) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and professional.Questions got straight to the point and very job related. Has some questions that may require you to go down memory lane but all in all a very easy process and given the ideal amount of time to answer or go back to answer the questions you struggled on.
Interview Questions: Describe how you manage conflict?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Had a somewhat brief phone interview with the hiring manager then a zoom call with potential coworkers and supervisor. Asked behavioral questions, but mostly about my past experience and how i would transfer those skills to the interview position.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about the position

title: Participating Arts Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through Indeed. A few days later, I was requested to schedule an over-the-phone interview for the position. A few days after this phone interview, I was requested to come in-person for a second interview. For this in-person interview, I was required to prepare a program schedule and outline planning an event, two requirements of the job.
Interview Questions: For the in-person interview, I was asked to bring in a draft of a program schedule that I would potentially run.

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through a current employee's post, got a call the next morning to schedule a phone interview in the afternoon the same day, interview took 15 minutes, next day I got a call offering me the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids?

title: Branch Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application, it took about 3 weeks to hear back. The first interview was a 30 minute video call with 3 area directors who asked general interview questions. It then took 2 weeks to be notified if I was selected to move on to the next round. My second interview was scheduled a week after. That interview was also a video call that was conducted by the COO and 2 Area Directors. An offer was given 4 days later. The entire process went very smooth beside the 3 week gap between interviews.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a part of Boys and Girls Club?

title: Teen Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Sebastian, FL) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an interview a few days later. I interviewed with the Facility Manager and Program Director. The interview was fairly easy, and it consisted of a question-and-answer period as well as a tour of the facility. I was then asked to fill out an supplementary application before leaving, while I filled that out the manager and director left me shortly and then came back to offer me the position pending a background check and drug test. I accepted initially, but ultimately had to turn the job down a few days later due to a personal family emergency, and no fault of the employer.
Interview Questions: Do you have any prior experience working with teens or children?

title: Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by about seven other employers who all had a chance to ask me questions after the general interview. They told me about the position and the hours then had a whole packet of interview questions and situations.
Interview Questions: How would you redirect a child's bad behavior?

title: Teen Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (West Palm Beach, FL) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Had pre interview through the phone (about 10 mins) and received a physical interview a week and a half later (10-15 mins). They asked a lot of scenario questions and wanted to highlight experiences you had with children
Interview Questions: Have you had experience working with teens?

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: A smooth and friendly interview process. I was able to picture myself working there as the interview panel was composed of young professionals who had a similar educational background to mine.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: H.R. Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Davenport, IA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview was well excuted. There were background questions and situational questions. The I had the chance to ask anything I wanted. The director who interviewed me was very kind and professional.
Interview Questions: What do you know about out company?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Houston, TX) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Simple and easy. Asked about my past work and didn’t keep me long because of my previous experience. I was offered the position but with my masters and there hourly rate. It just was not a good fit.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult children.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got an email scheduling a phone interview.  Then I had an in-person interview where I met with two different small groups of people.  They asked about my work history, how I can apply these skills to working at Boys & Girls Club,  Everyone was friendly and I was impressed by the facilities.
Interview Questions: How will you incorporate what the kids have learned into concrete examples of real-life applications?

title: Site Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Lake St Louis, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The Site Director was knowledgeable and transparent with the type of person they wanted to fill this role. She provided substantial background  information and she connected everything back to the mission of the organization.
Interview Questions: Describe your management style?

title: Youth Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: quick zoom interview. I was asked why I had applied/what interested me in bgc. A series of quick personal questions were also asked. The director along with a club member was present for the interview. all around took about 15 minutes
Interview Questions: three words to describe yourself

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position of YDS. Within two days I received an e-mail about their interest in my qualification and experience. The recruiter gave me a phone call a few days later and told me she would present my cover letter and resume to the supervisors and would let me know if I would be invited for an job interview. However, I never got updated about the status of my application. After I e-mailed the recruited, she said they already found someone who was a better fit for the position. They communicate poorly with applicants.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I found the posting on google jobs so I looked up their official website and completed the application there. After a month, I got a call and did my phone interview which took about 15 minutes or so. Then I was scheduled for in-person interview (this was before Covid-19). I received a hiring decision via email within a week.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with student who's refusing to follow your directions and interrupting peers?

title: Program Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Must love kids and be invested in our kids future. The role is varied based on the location and amount of children served in that area. Being creative and open minded is a great trait to have and always being open to criticism from the kids creates an amazing atmosphere for the customers, who just so happens to be children and like any business the customer is always right!
Interview Questions: Do you enjoy working with children?

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth and standard interview questions. For example, what is your strength and weakness, how well do you work under pressure, what is your experience working with children and plenty more that are standard! Very causal and nice people.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weaknesses?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: They ask the standard interview questions; tell me about yourself, experience, etc.   The interviewers were friendly and knew about the organization and its history. The interview had one person for the first and 4 for the second. The interview happened the same day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experience working with at-risk youth?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Creating and implementing character growth programs in local clubs. Also, understanding the day-to-day basics of the club dynamics. Supporting other staff and making sure each child is safe and engaged.
Interview Questions: What inspires you.

title: People Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: phone screen and panel interview with executives.  pretty casual and laid back. But did not get an offer. The organization does great would and it would've been an honor to work there
Interview Questions: what do you bring to the hr process?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough interview process.  Used Clifton Strengths Finder to ensure team fit. Several interviews with Executive director and board members. Ultimately selection came down to team fit. Although I was not selected, I appreciated how thorough the interview process was.
Interview Questions: Wanted a strengths finder test to ensure team fit.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview was laid back with many questions about my past experience as it relates to the role and how I would react in certain scenarios on the job. I also conducted an activity for the kids at my second interview which was an observational interview.
Interview Questions: What are three words others would use to decribe you?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed atmosphere with the direct supervisor who oversaw the program coordinators. She wanted to make sure that you had experience working with children of various backgrounds and ages. She went through what a typical day would look like
Interview Questions: Education background/work environment

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Austin, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Expect to have 2 to 3 rounds of interviews. The first round is a phone call interview. The second is a panel interview with the director and employees, and you could have a third interview with the CEO.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with tracking metrics behind your graphics on social media?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: one on one interview in her office. Asked general questions relating to how I would behave in certain situations. It was very relaxed and not too formal, not as bad as expected
Interview Questions: If a child was alone and upset, how would you go about helping them?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Naples, FL) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and fast process on how to get it. There were two people that interviewed me and it was pretty fast and not too long honestly but they just wanted to make sure they i had some sort of of experience with children and okay with the hours
Interview Questions: Experience with children How much you want to get paid

title: Professional Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Lancaster, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Zoom call with the district manager, asks your average interview questions and availability, also a drug test. Prepare well for questions they might ask such as why they should pick you. Dress to impress.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Boys and Girls Club?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview process flowed like a conversation and the interviewer's personality made the experience very comfortable. I ended up asking the interviewer more questions than she asked me. The Glassdoor interview questions for the organization really helped me to prepare!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Norman, OK)
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process was about 6 weeks. It wasn’t stressful at all. I interviewed with two people. They read the questions from a paper. Some of the questions were repetitive. However, I got a pretty good idea about what the job was about. 

When I was offered the position, I didn’t know what the pay would be. It wasn’t part of the job description. My advice is to not accept any position without knowing the pay. I worked a full day before I found out my pay.
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy on child development?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Būr) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I got a call one day after I applied online. They asked me to come in for an interview. It was a group interview where three of the directors took turns asking us questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself (hobbies, school)

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Port St Lucie, FL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy Questions are easy just need to be thought out well and have confidence  when answering the questions. It may feel intimidating but it is not . answer the questions truthfully  and honestly.
Interview Questions: What is your reason for this interview

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled a phone interview  for which the recruiter was late and not very apologetic.  Went through an hour long phone interview to be told that they had an internal hire in the pipeline and would keep me on file as a backup candidate if I was interested in continuing with an in person interview with the hiring team.  Recruiter was very unprofessional and poorly prepared.  Told them I was not interested in continuing with the process
Interview Questions: You have great experience, tell me about X,Y,Z on your resume? Interview was nothing more than a recap of previous experience

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Fayetteville, AR)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward. They want to make sure that whoever they hire as YDP staff is going to be someone who has experience working with kids or is genuinely interested in the well-being of the children they are going to be working with.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with children?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Garden Grove, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process. Quite nervous since it was my first ever interview. Just went into a meeting room, there was two hiring coordinator that took turns asking the question. They wrote notes as they ask. Took a basic algebra and English exam that was about 50 questions, multiple choice. Very easy. Easy interview.
Interview Questions: What are two activities and how to they coordinate with list of their core values.

title: Summer Program Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Frisco, TX) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen on Wednesday, then they interviewed a ton of people on Thursday, training was the next day on Friday, and summer camp started three days later on Monday. The interview was about 8 minutes with the branch's CEO and COO, and one of them was on the phone for most of it. Quick and easy. There was also a drug test and background check.
Interview Questions: What are your three greatest strengths?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Garden Grove, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
There are two interviews, phone screening interview and then they have you go interview with a site supervisor / club director or Lead / Program Coordinator.

Then you take a test on math / english skills.
Interview Questions: tell us about a time you de escalated a situation?

title: Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Real simple. The questions aren't bad, and they simply want to know what experience you have. There were some scenario questions, but if you have worked with kids before you know what it's like to be on your toes.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with two kids fighting in the bathroom?

title: Psychology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Pedro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was supposed to be a group interview, if memory serves. But I remember arriving and being the only one present; the other four guys who were supposed to arrive being no shows. So the interviewer just sat down with me in here office and started asking questions. Twenty minutes later, she said I was hired for the Psychology Intern position.
Interview Questions: It was a while ago, so I don't remember the questions word-for-word. But I remember her asking what I thought was the best means to connect with a child.

title: Data Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
I'd first like to say that I had no interest in this position with Boys & Girls Clubs of San Francisco. I only accepted the invitation to  interview, so that I can get into the habit of interviewing as I look to depart from my current employer. 

I applied online and received a response about two days later for a phone interview. After my phone interview, I was immediately scheduled for an in-person interview that same week. I had my in-person interview where I got to meet the unit, followed by a second in-person interview (following week) where I had the chance to meet additional staff members. The first interview was pretty much a Q & A with that unit I'd be working with, and the second interview consisted of a panel of folks, and ended with a skills assessment (which I wasn't aware of because I was never informed).  

The vibe in the room for both in-person interviews was completely off. I could sense that everyone who I met was under a lot of stress and pressure, so that really was a huge red flag for me. On top of that, they were offering a very low hourly rate for position, and you wouldn't get paid for your lunches which would lower your  income severely.  The biggest turn off for me was the lack of growth and learning in the position.  I consider myself a lifelong learner, so I would get pretty bored with the position because of it's repetitive nature.  Anyway,  after the first interview, I really couldn't see myself working there, so I didn't put any effort into the second interview.

Bottom line is, if you're looking to growth, thrive and survive, please don't consider a job at this organization.
Interview Questions: Many stupid question's such as: What animal do you consider yourself?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Pedro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a very basic one-on-one sort meeting. Initially, I was supposed to be interviewed as part of a group. However, none of the other applicants scheduled to join me arrived. After a brief Q&A between the interviewer and myself, I hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: The most important question I can remember being asked that day is, "What is your approach to communicating with others?"

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Garden Grove, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, set of standard questions. The hiring manager along with one other interviewed me. I was asked to complete a knowledge based test that same day as part of the job duties is helping kids with homework.
Interview Questions: Share 2 activities with the kids

title: Manager of Creative Design and Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The process included two tests and conversations with 2 managers. The tests were not difficult, one writing test, and one design test. You are given maybe 45 minutes to complete both which can be nerve racking but very possible. I enjoyed the process and everyone I met with was great and professional. I also appreciate the follow up I received. I did not get the position but the department was very responsive and polite in informing me of their decision.
Interview Questions: What makes you angry?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy.  Laid back.  They have their people do a lot of work on top of helping with the kids.  I like the job just not the leadership so just be careful with that.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to clean bathrooms and pass out meals

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Carson, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was fairly easy and was done through the phone. They did not ask for much. All they working for was any prior experience working with other children and what job title you had if you have. They also wanted to know the age range within that experience.
Interview Questions: Q: Have you ever worked with children before?

title: Early Childhood Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Johnson City, TN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: They asked questions that had no logical answer, then throw you into a volunteer job as your second interview, and give you absolutely zero direction on what you're supposed to be doing. You'll be told you're just shadowing to learn how everything works, and then be told you didn't do enough.
Interview Questions: Do you know the arts consists of more than drawing or painting?

title: Writer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview process. I submitted writing samples, had a phone interview with HR, then came in for the interview with the team.  Asked me the typical questions "why do you want to work here," "tell us about yourself," and "what would you miss from your current job"?
Interview Questions: What would you miss from your current job?

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was positive; they have a 3-step process (phone, in-person with multiple people, and finally, come in and run a program with the kids).  The phone and in-person were positive, they asked good questions and I answered to the best of my ability. I did not hear back after the second interview, despite reaching out to them.
Interview Questions: What program would I create if I had the opportunity to create one, how would I run it, and measure for success?

title: Teen Education Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty average. It is standard and routine. There are 3 rounds of interviews that take place.  I actually enjoyed the interview process. The people there are great.
Interview Questions: What programs would you facilitate too the members?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Sat down one on one (although they told me it's usually two people), few questions, quick interview nothing complicated. Was talking about hobbies and what I found interesting in working with kids.
Interview Questions: What interests you in working with kids?

title: Assistant Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Corvallis, OR) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Fairly quick response through email/phone to set-up an in person interview. Asked me pretty casual job related questions and got back to me within a few days. Starting work was very quick, just gotta wait for a background check to go through.
Interview Questions: If you were to plan an activity with the kids what would you do?

title: Data Entry Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Fernandina Beach, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I hear about the position from a friend.  She said to use Glassdoor to submit an application which I did.  Once submitted, there was an immediate response from Boys & Girls Club to complete some questions on line.  Contact made by phone within three days. Time and location of interview were arranged convenient to both within the week.

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Chelsea, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I felt super welcomed and comfortable during the interview. Such a great environment and seems like a great place to work. I was told I would be invited back for a second interview during the first interview.

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Gainesville, GA) in Dec 2018

FYI: you have to bring in your own materials fo the background check. After the interview they send you home with a checklist of items to bring back during the next 8-10 days.

title: Program Coordinator Interview

A couple of times the panel member would mention, " you kind of answered this but feel free to give another example."

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a phone call a week or so later and then had an in person interview. Was hired on the spot after that interview. Interview process was overall very easy and conversational in nature
Interview Questions: "What made you want to work here?"

title: Yourh Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Moline, IL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met one on one with the club director. I was asked a few questions and it was a very laid back interview. I then went around the club and then was asked to talk to the members for about an hour.

title: Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Different for each place probably, laid back interview didn't take much time, felt comfortable, one on one with director, explained a lot of what the job was about and asked if I felt like we were a good fit for each other and explained my background
Interview Questions: Have you worked with kids before

title: Stem Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Jersey City, NJ) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, they want to gauge if you have the right temperament to work with underprivileged inner city kids. They also probed my level of passion about experimenting with science.

title: Coordinator Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Elkhart, IN) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was light and fun. They asked the typical questions and were very friendly.  I sat with two higher level managers and just talked about my passion with work with children and how at least for the time being I wanted to work somewhere not just for the money.

title: Juvenile Hall Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick. They wanted to get to know you and how you would handle situations. There were many questions listed on the page of questions she was going to ask, however, she skipped around.
Interview Questions: What do you think you would bring to this site?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with a Boys and Girls Club of Metro LA executive went smoothly, but then they failed to reach out to me when they said they would. Additionally, I sent a follow up email to check in on the status of my application and no word. If this is how they treat applicants, then I can imagine how they treat their employees.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions regarding the description and duties?

title: Music Program Head Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Kingston, ON) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: We walked around the facility and spoke about the job, what it would entail, and what my experience was. They showed me the studio space and talked about its history and how the music program came into existence. We talked about the values of the organization, which include forming relationships and learning life lessons, rather than merely developing skills. Overall, it was a positive interview experience. The interviewers were extremely nice.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with music production software?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Las Vegas, NV) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is just to see how your personality will fit within the team. Your program director will be interviewing you. You will mainly discuss your past experiences.

title: Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Lampasas, TX) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very simple straight to the point. All the regular interview questions. They ask why you would like the position and how comfortable you are with children. They get back to you very fast on weather you have been accepted or declined for the job.

title: Program Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Super easy and relaxed. They asked simple questions like why do you want to work here. Give an example of how you would deal with certain situations. They asked about 5 questions and I was only there for maybe 10-15 minutes. After a day or two they hired me.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with kids

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Diego, CA) in May 2018

Interview Questions: They asked situation based questions like what would you do if a kid came up to you crying and the child said it was because another camper hit him.

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and friendly interview process. The interviews feel conversational and past experience with the organization or other organizations dedicated to supporting children and youths appears to be a big plus.
Interview Questions: Please tell us more about your background and how this may have prepared you for this role?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Orlando, FL) in May 2018

Interview Questions: Behavioral

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview

Interview Descriptions: I had a 30 minute phone interview first with a program assistant. After the phone interview,  I had an hour in person interview with the director. I was also given a tour of the facilities. I really appreciated the organization and  the quickness of this company in the hiring process. Everyone I have met has seemed genuinely excited about their positions and working with children.  I would highly recommend  applying with this company.
Interview Questions: Describe your past experience working with children

title: Area Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Bristol, TN) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: There honestly wasn't much to it. They are so in need of employees that they will basically hire anyone given you can pass a background check. I walked in and was offered the job the same day. I talked a little with the director of the club, and then filled out paperwork.
Interview Questions:
Q: What experience do you have working with children?
Q: What kind of pay do you expect?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview went very well and it was really easy to talk to the interviewer. She mostly asked me to expand on things found on my resume! Suggested that I look at two other positions that she felt matched my qualifications.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience at this job?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Milpitas, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and it was a simple process. They asked for a cover letter and resume. I received a response within a week and that was great. I was called in for an interview and upon my arrival everything seemed great. The interview was going well and we were organically talking and sharing information. One of the two interviewers gave me a 45 minutes background of what they predict for the role and I was able to add some input. They were happy I had taken the time to read their strategic plan online. One of the interviewers had to leave and I continued with the other. The entire 2 hours felt more like a training than an interview and I didn't mind at all; I assumed they liked my background and we hit it off. 

Two weeks and three unanswered emails later I get a call with an offer; she asked me if we had discussed salary and I said no. We didn't discuss anything. I had emailed a couple of times thanking them for the opportunity and it took weeks to get a response just to get an offer that would make it hard for me to live anywhere local. I respectfully asked if they would consider matching my salary from my previous employer and she said she would gladly speak to the supervisor and CEO. I never heard from them again. If they couldn't afford it that's find but to not respond to any of my emails or to at least have the curtesy to reject me is unprofessional. It upset me because I really liked the role and its something I really wanted to do.
Interview Questions: Mostly conversational.

title: Teen Activities Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short and effective. It was nice to have the process move quick and painlessly. I appreciated them giving me all of the information that they needed upfront. I was able to provide it immediately and was hired on the spot during the interview.
Interview Questions: Name and describe a program that you could implement immediately?

title: Account Relationship Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Interview with national director of acct relationships,  meeting with Lead directors, Panel interview, conference Call with vice President of cause partnerships,  Other interviews as needed, very long process so it could take up to three or four months
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of Boys and Girls Club’s of America, what are three strengths you have that you will bring to the mall what are three opportunities you need to strengthen, how do you collaborate with others

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: There was three steps to the interview process. First one was on the phone with the HR director, second interview was in person with two directors, and finally the third interview as in one of the clubs. I prepared and facilitated a 45 minute program with 15-20 youth.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Homework Room Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Scottsdale, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: It was fun, low key and comfortable. The interviewer (my boss) was down to earth and real about the position. The interview was at the club. I was offered the position after my interview and he asked that I get drug tested as soon as I could so I can start right away. The next day I went in for my fingerprints.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself helping out at risk youth in your community?

title: Mentor Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The application and interview process was very straight forward. I applied online and got a phone call for an interview the next day. As mentioned, the interview questions were straight forward and were based on the job description.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you have working with kids?

title: Childcare Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Kingsport, TN) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process to be always mediocre and stupid, the questions asked the same thing and did not get to the point at all. I felt very uncomfortable sitting there
Interview Questions: Have you had to fill out paper work for a child

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Garden Grove, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy- but they will make you an offer and if you dont accept right then and there they will fill the position. Got an offer on a Monday  and called Tuesday and Wednesday and left messages since they were not in the office. Then called again on Thursday and they said they filled all the positions. AFTER OFFERING ME ON. Very unprofessional organization. Will hire anyone even if they show up to the interview with jeans and a t-shirt...
Interview Questions: 2 programs designed for the kids

title: Membership Coordinator/Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume at the Rotterdam clubhouse, Was called within a few days for an interview. I was interviewed by the Unit Director and Area Director. I was asked many questions about my Microsoft experience, customer service, and handling many stressful situations at one time. The interview lasted about 1 hour and when finished was told they were going to call my references and give me a call back for the next step. When I received the call back I was set up to do a background check which took about 1 week to come back and was then offered the job.
Interview Questions: How did I handle stressful situations?

title: Leadership Academy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Hobe Sound, FL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a quick interview followed by two in person interviews come prepared to answer questions of your leader capability. All in all easy interview just be prepared with all job duties
Interview Questions: How have you lead in. Difficult situation in the past?

title: Manager of Kids Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Akward. It wasw on the phone and it wasnt scheduled. I was taken off guard and not in a place where I could openly taslk but I didnt want top come across rudely. So I was distracted and I wasnt able to interview as well as I normally would.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple. They asked several questions and everyone was friendly. I found the job posting through their website then called to ask about the interviewing and application process.

title: Lead Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Was given a test prior to interview. Test consisted of high school level math and english. After that I was interviewed by a 2 person panel which lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Resource Development and Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Moline, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
got introduced by a point of contact, submitted my resume and cover letter via email, set up an interview via email with the supervisor
interviewed within 3 days at the central office
got feed back that they would contact the manager about the process
heard back the next day about the result
got the job

title: Activity Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Bakersfield, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the Activity Leader/Program Aide through the Boys and Girls Club of Kern County  website in May 2017 and they called me to schedule an interview by early June 2017 . I had to reschedule my first interview at the end of June 2017, and they were able to reschedule for July 2017. When I arrived to my interview, I interviewed with HR. The interview had a lot of questions related to working with children/students, as well as whether the location of the schools and transportation to and from work would be an issue. I received a job offer approximately 2 weeks later at the end of July 2017. I accepted the job offer and scheduled an appointment to fill out paperwork, get my fingerprints scanned, and receive my information for the school site and coordinator I would be reporting to.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your experience working with children.

What skills do you have that you can implement in the classroom as activities? For example are you artistic, or are you good at dancing? 

The schools we work with are based on the East Side of Bakersfield, would transportation and commute be an issue for you?

How would you handle the situation of a student constantly disrupting the class?

Why do you want to work at the Boys and Girls Club as an activity leader?

title: Councilor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Paterson, NJ) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Laid back. More of a conversation than being drilled with questions. It was very welcoming and was a great first time interview to prepare me for future ones after college.
Interview Questions: What are your hobbies?  What are you good at?

title: Program Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: First there was a short fifteen  minute phone interview, followed by an in person interview 1.5 weeks later at the location of the job with the supervisor of the position
Interview Questions: What is one skill you need to work on?

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Denver, CO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds with the second being a “homework assignment” which took around 7 hours to complete. After going through each round I was turned down and offered an entry level position which required far less responsibility and offer far less pay.
Interview Questions: Put together a advertising campaign using a strict budget.

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Easy and simple
Contacted me very quickly and gave me job on the spot due to how short staffed they were and ones own experience days later started working there
Interview Questions: What do u like about working with kids ?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Tampa, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the person who'd be my supervisor. The interview was relaxed and warm; my boss was really genuine and has really high hopes for the program. I was interviewed at the club, so I also had to interact with the children (they do this in purpose to make sure that you can deal with the children and still be able to do your work)
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you demonstrated independence and initiative

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short into the point. I was well-qualified, seeing as I was a recent college graduate with a masters in criminal justice.  I left the interview feeling as though I had a great shot at getting the job, which I did.
Interview Questions: How do you feel you can help kids?

title: Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (South Lake Tahoe, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume in person for a summer position I was almost immediately contacted for a short interview. We scheduled a phone interview and they were quite friendly during the entire process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with youth?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Very quick almost too speedy. The interview felt rushed and there wasn't really a formal offer made just kind of assumed that I got it. Afterwards I began on boarding right away and was thrown in with absolutely zero training.
Interview Questions: What are your Marketing Skills?

title: Financial Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
First telephone  interview and panel interview  with three BGCA employees (the manager, a team member, or someone in a similar position).  This was an internal interview, I was applying for a position in a different department.
For a position in Finance I didn't have to prepare a presentation, but for other positions that require specialized knowledge, they may be required to present a speech or presentation.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you are interested in working in the finance department?

title: Site Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Michigan City, IN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: In person interview, tour of the Boys and Girls Club, introduced to members and staff of the Club,  submitted three job references for review, drug test right after interview
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with children?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Sent in application, was followed up by email with program director, had one interview and received offer 1 week later. Some of my coworkers did not have the same timeline.
Interview Questions: When have you worked with kids?

title: Site Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, very basic questions about your background. be sure to draw from your experiences and apply them to the question that they asked. very simple, if you have experience you will do well
Interview Questions: I do not remember the questions but they were based off of my resume

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I found the interview process unreasonable. After a phone interview, I was given three days to review a poorly written 20 page document on their strategic plan and then write a 10 minute presentation on my recommendations, and review and provide feedback to their newsletter. The interview consisted of the presentation, an hour or so of behavioral interviewing and then a forty minute writing exercise. I think two of the three (presentation, newsletter, and/or writing sample) would have been a bit extreme, but acceptable. On a good note, it did help me understand that culture at BCGA was not what I was looking for.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best fit for this position?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (McComb, MS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was a small setting with both directors and office manager. Quick and to the point. Questions were to the point. They asked alot about your love for children and how you handle chaos.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths?

title: Youth Development Professional (YDP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Garden Grove, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, in person interview, in person assessment . The HR team was friendly and supportive. It seems like they care about their people. I really felt at ease during the interview.
Interview Questions: my experience working with kids

title: Academy Services Tutor Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Relatively a long process in relation to the low hours and pay for the position. 2 to 3 days after submitting my CV, I got a call from the company asking for a phone interview.
