After the phone interview, I had to go in for a test--50 multiple choice questions on literacy (basic reading comprehension, spelling, and grammar) , algebra (basic algebra, would be helpful if you recap some of the very basic formulas) and ability to assist (hypothetical situation questions)--You have to get 85% in each part in order for you to be qualified for the job. If you don't pass, you are automatically disqualified for the position. After passing the test, I went to another location to have an in-person interview. The interviewer briefly explained about the services and duties for the position and went through a set of questions. She read each question and wrote down what I said. I wished there was more natural conversation during this process. The process felt really robotic and felt under pressure because you do all the talking.
Interview Questions: One student keeps disrupting a group tutoring session. What would be your short and long term solutions for this situation.

title: Youth Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and consice. They make sure that you have a passion for working with youth. They try to be as professional as they can. In my case I got hired the day I interviewed.
Interview Questions: Do you know any techniques to calm down students?

title: Unit Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Boise, ID)
Interview Descriptions: Had the interview with the director and programs manager. Both were very friendly and engaged in the questioning. Initially they said it was a casual interview, although the 4 pages of questions seemed otherwise. There were personal questions about experience, situational questions,  leadership questions and questions about what you would do in the position. We clicked, and although I did not get the job due to giving it to someone internal, I enjoyed the process and they made it much easier.
Interview Questions: Define integrity, define your leadership style...

title: Youth Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Bernardino, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one in a group and another independent. Very easy just described the expectations. Took one test to see your math and English skills. They work with school schedules.
Interview Questions: What is one game that you'd invent with a basketball that is also educational?

title: Marketing Inter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Stevens Point, WI) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Formal questions, friendly staff, open ended and you could tell the manager truly cared what your answers were. Truly felt appreciated and excited to help a bigger thing than me
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Site Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted application online through Indeed, went through a phone interview/screening a week later, set up an in-person interview one week later, interviewed by two women who took turns asking situational questions regarding administration, leadership, and programming. I took a short test on english and math in order to show basic proficiency

Received a job offer one hour later
Interview Questions: How would you handle having multiple deadlines and a planned event all in one week

title: Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Manhattan, KS) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was laid back and I felt it was more like a conversation of what I have done and what they do. The process in which it took me to hear back was seemingly long, although I had heard good things from them.
Interview Questions: What would you do in this scenario... What if a kid did this... etc.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The use an interview panel of 4 to 5 people and conduce a behavior interview.  It lasts for at least 45 minutes to 1 hour.  The panel repeated some of the questions by rewording.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to make an unpopular decision

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Ames, IA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward and well structured, emphasizing on experience related to teaching and working with youth. I was interviewed by the director of operations and a program coordinator.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that will positively impact our kids.

title: Activity Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Applied through an ad online. Interview process was fairly neutral. I have a feeling that the questions vary from site to site. I met with a panel of 3 people, two of which actually work at the BGC, one of whom was a community volunteer. The questions they asked were fairly standard and they seemed pleased that I had written notes down about the organization. I was brought in for second interview, in which I interacted with the kids.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? What experience do you have that makes you qualified for this job? What do you know about the Boys and Girls Club?

title: Teen Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Kings Beach, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was videoed with the current Lead and Club Manager. It was a personal yet professional interview that included an emphasis on expectations as well as inputs that could help improve the current role.
Interview Questions: What type of program do you feel you would like to introduce with the club that would increase the participation of the enrolled students?

title: ydp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly easy. Went through a phone interview, had to to take a basic skills test, then got called for a regular interview.  Didnt take long to get a call after each step.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with members that are misbehaving

title: Part Time Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I asked question of past experience. I answered with previous experiences I had and what I learned from them.  They also asked why what was a failure in the past and what I learned from it.
Interview Questions: What previous jobs did you have?

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Boston, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was incredibly laid back. It was the most comfortable interview I've ever been to. It felt more like a double sided conversation than a formal interview. We were basically just getting to know each other. He had my resume in hand and basically just asked me to elaborate on my college experience, my current job experience. At the end of the interview he said he had one more interview and would be back in touch within the week.
Interview Questions: Why did I decide to apply to a club type job?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Napa, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 Interviews. 1st interviewed by the director at the main clubhouse, then I was interviewed by a coordinator of one of the school sites. They basically asked the same questions each time. After I was offered the job, I had to do a mandatory background check and TB screening. The process took nearly a month in between
Interview Questions: Very standard interview questions (ie why do you want to work here, what experience have you had working with children, what is your availability, what kinds of activities would you design, how have you had to work in a team, what do you consider to be the traits of a role model, etc)

title: After School Program Staff Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: It was good. I sent in my resume, was called the next morning, interview was the next day. I was interviewed by a three person panel and was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What is an example of bad disciplinary action?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a relaxed and easy going interview process. They have two different interview sessions and the questions are the same for each but different interviewers. If you are inspired in your answers, it will aid you.
Interview Questions: Why work with kids?

title: Sports Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Hollywood, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two staff members. They asked about my education and extra curricular activities. Then gave me a tour of facility. They then offered me the job at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: How have you given back to community?

title: Teacher's Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Itta Bena, MS) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short and simple because of my relationship with the director for I was a product of the boys and girls club myself. With that being said, I was hired at the club to help out with the kids.
Interview Questions: What are you goals for the boys and girls club?

title: Club Service Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Miami, FL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: very flexible, they were open to allowing me to change the original schedule date and were very communicative and open to new possibilities. I was pleased with the transparency of the group, and how open-ended they were about the details and the ins and outs of the role that I had applied to and was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: You the Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy. The people were curious of my previous work history and asked about my personally. They got to know what I can do and how they may utilize it I. The future.
Interview Questions: What might you do in a situation where a kid is on top of another member out of anger?

title: Kitchen Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Eau Claire, WI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview over the phone. The interview was pretty basic with questions like "why do you want this job" "tell me about yourself" etc. The majority of the interview was spent going over how things work there, and a tour of the facility. She then described the job and what it was going to be like to see if I was still interested.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in for two interviews (they had to reschedule the first, however) to meet with various senior staff, and they offered me the job at the conclusion of the second. The salary was low, and when I asked about benefits, the offer was rescinded. I've never experienced something so shockingly unprofessional in my career and regret giving this organization the consideration that I did. Tread with caution.
Interview Questions: "What makes you angry?" was, hilariously enough, the first question.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview.  I came to the organization with a significant CV and long history of success.  I was recommended by city leadership and media attention.  Met with Staff for initial interview.  Then interviewed by Executive Director
Interview Questions: How do you go about your work?

title: Club Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone screen with HR to review your skills.  They also check your reference and run a background check which takes a few weeks to complete.  HR will finally schedule a 3 person panel interview.  One person was the supervisor and the other two were from other departments.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to overcome a major obstacle that stood in the way of you accomplishing a goal.  How did you approach the situation?

title: Basketball Referee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Kirkland, WA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Athletic Director the day after I applied(earlier that day he had emailed me asking if I could come in for the training they were having that evening and an interview). I was trained on the spot, which was maybe an hour process(mostly paperwork).
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with the rules of High School Basketball?

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. After 5 weeks contacted via email on Friday at 5pm asked to answer 20 extensive questions and return by Monday at 10am. Completed work and sent in on Sunday. Contacted via email a week later to expect a phone call the next day to schedule a phone interview the next day. Call came in after 5pm, schedule interview. Phone interview was prompt and the HR person was vibrant and upbeat. Only asked on question and then spent 40 mins telling me about the position, company, department etc. Told me I was being recommended for the next round of interviews. It would either be a Skype, phone call or in person (travel would be covered). Highly complimentary about my resume, experience and question submission. Told there was a relocation budget also told that I would be sent the benefits package to review by the end of the week and would also be contact about the schedule for the next round of interviews by the end of the week. I never heard from them by the end of the week. I waited until the following week to send an email requesting an update, no response, one week later I sent in another request for an update and to make sure that I didn't miss anything, no response. That was my last contact. Please note that I did sent a thank yous following each interview. Very disappointed about the way they handle the process. They shouldn't be specific if they aren't going to follow through or they should touch base to let you know if there is a change in the timeline, plan or your candidacy etc.
Interview Questions: Emailed questions were extensive, challenged and justified. On phone interview one question: Why did you want to work there?

title: Program Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Virginia Beach, VA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was straight forward. I applied through a job board, immediately got an interview and was hired at the same time. The interview was conducted by the unit director in a very friendly manner. The whole time he was smiling and attentively listening to my answers.
Interview Questions: How  do you overcome challenges at work place?

title: Education Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Austin, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: 35 minute interview with a panel of three people. I sent an email resume and I was called in for an interview within a few days. They asked me standard questions from a paper from the company. Not very difficult.
Interview Questions: If you had to describe yourself in one word, what would it be?

title: Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Nacogdoches, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Short easy and to the point. They ask why you want work with kids and examples of why you think you can handle it. They also ask what you know about the company and if you have any questions for them. Make sure you have questions to ask them it makes a difference.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the company

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Many staff involved in the process. Hands on interaction with youth part of the interview. Several interviews - four - before given a job offer. Interview seemed subjective and completely based on the personalities and interests of hiring manager. Same questions asked repeatedly. Lots of questions on what I could bring to the team. Not many questions about my educational background.
Interview Questions:
What's your vision for yourself in 5 years? 
What new ideas would you bring?
What are examples of working on a team setting?

title: Site Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was great.  It really helped me to understand the organization and what they stand for. The staff was extremely knowledgeable about the organization and all its need and procedures.
Interview Questions: How do you operate under stress?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Statesville, NC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call back about a week later to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview was very easy: 3 to 5 broad questions about experience, strengths and weaknesses, etc. At the end of the phone interview I was asked to do an in-person interview. At the in-person interview, I was interviewed by two women who took turns asking questions. There were about 10 or 15 questions, all of which were very specific to the job and required an in-depth response. If offered the position, they do a background check and drug screen.
Interview Questions: Two children begin to fight, one runs out of the room, and another vomits. You're the only adult in the room. What do you do?

title: RD Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone, I was never called into the office or an in-person interview. The hiring manager gave me a phone screening to verify my information but she never made it clear which position I was going to be interviewed for since I had submitted several applications to distinct positions.
Interview Questions: knowledge of Microsoft Office

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: They conducted the interview in a timely manner and all questions were useful. No questions were asked just to fill time. They were very professional and got back to me with a job offer in a short amount of time. They were clear on job expectations and did not beat around the bush on what is expected from you on the job. They were friendly and showed that it was a good place to work.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Sat and talked in a quiet office with the Assistant Director. Very relaxed and upbeat. Lasted for 15 minutes. Doesn't ask any situational questions. Then they call you on the phone to tell you whether or not you got the position.
Interview Questions: What experience you have with kids and teaching. How well you work with a team.

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds interviews. The first round interview was about 45 minutes and has gone through all of the experiences especially working with kids.  The second round interview was basically putting me into the club and observe how I interacted with kids.
Interview Questions: What Disney character would you like to be?

title: 21st Century Enrichment Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Knoxville, TN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two grant worker ladies interviewed me. They were very nice and the interview was relatively short (~10-15 minutes), they said that was standard and not indicative of a bad interview. I just kept making sure to mention that it's important to listen, make learning fun, and that I was very eager to be there and had heard rave reviews from other employees.
Interview Questions: What is the most challenging thing about working with children?

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was decent, It started with a phone interview where the HR representative asked questions about your experience and general conflict resolution questions. Days later I got a call that I was chosen for the in person interview. There were about 5 pages of questions that each person in the room took turns asking you. I got offered the job a few hours after that interview.
Interview Questions: What would you consider your biggest weakness?

title: Swim Instructor/Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Hamilton, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: First called in to do an in person interview. I was interviewed by the lead lifeguard and the head of aquatics. The next stage of the process was the fitness test. Was asked to complete the timed swim as well as the brick carry. I was then asked to demonstrate lifesaving skills in a mock rescue situation.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had difficulty working in a team and how did you solve the problem.

title: Classroom Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: typical questions. easy group to talk to. seemed to be very concerened about who they were hiring. let me know up front what was expected of me. wanted me to know what i needed to perform the job.
Interview Questions: What is your role in discipline with children in the classroom?

title: After School Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked me questions on why I wanted to work at the club and why I would be a good fit.  However, the interviewer chose to point out all of the negative aspects of the job and club, even after I tried to spin stuff towards a positive.
Interview Questions: Do you have a bus license or are you willing to obtain one?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Salem, OR)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short at the location I ended up working at,  cool manager. The interview at the main location downtown was long and tedious. There was a second interview were they want to see how well you interact with kids and if you can run a children's based program.  Advice is to just get active with them have fun and do something easy and creative
Interview Questions: How do you go about dealing with an escalating child

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Appleton, WI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Initially, there was a brief phone interview. 

During the face-to-face interview, details of the job were explained to me more thoroughly, followed by a tour of the facility. Upon returning to the office where we had begun the interview process, I had the opportunity to give more personal background and answer some questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a child who was acting disrespectfully?

title: Site Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Edmonds, WA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call to set up an interview. When I showed up for the interview I tried handing the interviewer a copy of my resume and cover letter, but she refused them and put her hands up in the air and waved them. She told me to save the papers for my files. She had me interview in a room with no solid door and with about 20 kids in the next room and I could hardly hear her. Towards the end of the interview the interviewer informed me that the director job pays $10.00 to $11:00 per hour. I lost interest for the position at that point as fast food jobs in the area pay more. For the amount of responsibility the wage is way too low.
Interview Questions: Are you ok with making $10.00 to $11.00 per hour?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Redlands, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was two in-depth interviews. I was required to come in and have 1:1 interview, was notified two weeks later that they wanted me to come in for another interview. For the second interview two people interviewed me. I was then told 2-3 days later that I had received the position.
Interview Questions: Basic get to know you stuff.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Haverhill, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online from craigslist posting.  Heard back from the company within two days.  Interviewed the next day.  Interview was short and easy.  Just visited for a few minutes about the job and what it would entail.  I received an offer that day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The organization is really interested in about who you are as a person. Not only do they want you to perform a great but also want you to serve as a role model for the childen.
Interview Questions: What are some of your flaws

title: Strategy & Analysis Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I was directed towards Vitality Vending by my University, and joined the team there after an in-person interview with the career program employee of my school and a phone interview with the owner of Vitality Vending.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in food and vending for?

title: Activity Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It's so easy. less than 20 minutes. Simple common sense questions anyone can answer about how to work with kids. If you're a mom, dad, older sister or brother it should be ver easy and effortless. I actually was hired because I was a former club kid at another location so I already had a lot of experience and had networks.
Interview Questions: If there is a spill, what do you do?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Jacksonville, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was really relaxed and easy to answer questions. I applied in person to a club that I heard was low staffed, went in and asked to fill out an application with the lady at the front desk. I brought in my resume of which I have had one year prior work with the boys and girls club in my hometown of marion county. I left and not even 15 minutes on the road back home I got a call from the boss and we were able to schedule an interview.
Interview Questions: How I would handle if two kids got in a fight

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Natchitoches, LA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Not really a process, Since I did help out as much as I could. The process was really easy and I enjoyed it.  Id suggest everyone that has a few extra minutes to go help.
Interview Questions: When was the first time you heard about  BGC

title: Activity Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions:
3 step process:
Written application process and call back. 
2. Met with an interviewer and basically talked about my experience with students, and misc fielding questions about how I would diffuse problems with students and parents. 
Finally, met with the last person who asked more about teaching and mentoring techniques. A significant portion of interview was an impromptu lesson plan request. Was asked to create an activity for students at any level, whichever subject, and to make it fun!
Interview Questions: How would you deal with problem students?

title: Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short and sweet. Asked about schedule availability, passion, and approach as a caretaker/counselor. Spoke about member demographics and my experience with different backgrounds. Informed me about neighborhood and members different age groups.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was extremely brief and straight forward. No trick questions. Most of the questions revolved around what was on my resume and my experience working with children. A lot of questions also focused on how I work with other individuals.
Interview Questions: The pay isn't great. Why do you want to work here?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Halls, TN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sat in a room with two of the directors from that location and they asked me many questions. It was a friendly environment and they made me feel comfortable. They called me about 3 days later and told me I got the job. I then had to get a drug test and background check.
Interview Questions: How would you handle certain situations with the kids?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Stuart, FL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through email by sending in my resume. I was soon after contacted for a phone interview, and then was invited to be interviewed on-site by two women in person. The interviewers were fun and friendly, and at the end I was told I would be contacted within three days with a yes or no.
Interview Questions: How would you convince a child to try a food that they don't like?

title: Director of National Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then panel interview. It was pretty straight forward, panel shooting questions at you..  A lot of head nodding..  Seems with the organization that it's not as Diversity friendly, as it tries to sell itself.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a situation where you had conflict with another staff member and how did you handle it?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Annapolis, MD) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called within a few days of applying online. Did a phone interview, did a on-site interview, interviewed with head of AAC BGCA, hired by head on-spot, Location change immediately after accepting position.
Interview Questions: What about you makes you fit for a position at BGCA?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Had one hour interview with three different teams of two to five people, phone interview with ED and did not meet in person till after hired.  Not sure who everyone on panel was and why they were onvolved.
Interview Questions: Vague and more about personality than skills

title: After School Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Owensboro, KY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a very short interview. Of course its going to be different for everyone depending on where you live. But they took me in a room, asked me about my avaliabilty and gave me two scenario questions. Then the interviewer started talking about policies and uniforms and asked me to fill out the paper work. I had been hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness you have?

title: Lead Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Oshkosh, WI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't much of an interview. hired on the spot because they were very short staff. there was no official interview. Had to go through a couple of hours of videos on the training.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Costa Mesa, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received a call to interview with the CEO of Boys and Girls Club in Costa Mesa, CA. Scheduled interview and attended interview at their site in Costa Mesa. After the interview I submitted an application and never received a follow up. I did not follow up with them since I felt it was not a good fit.
Interview Questions: How do you spend your weekends?

title: Activity Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume and cover letter online, called back in 2 days. Interview was long, a lot of situational questions, eg. "what would you do if.." It was the director and co director who interviewed me, both were very nice and approachable. Informal setting but still very difficult on the spot questions that caught me off guard, some were difficult because I didn't know their policies on certain issues (such as disciplining) nor could I find any info on them online...
Interview Questions: What would you do if two children started to physically fight?

title: Activity Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Bloomington, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: A very typical interview. No curve balls. The staff just wants to see that you are passionate about their mission. They need people in the job who at the core of it all just want to help the kids.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Boys & Girls Club?

title: Membership Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Davie, FL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: They call you in and you have a group conversation with three people, the director, her assistant, and another manager. Kind of like a group interview except instead of applicants it's all the bosses, and they all just throw questions at you. For example, are you good with kids, why are you a good fit, what are your strengths and weaknesses? etc...
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with children?

title: Unit Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview process deals with how you respond to problems. They ask questions and then ask what your response would be in a dangerous situation or a situation where you do not feel comfortable. They also ask you about your skill level and previous experience.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a child who is uncomplient with the rules, but you later find out from the parent that he/she has a disability and a behavioral problem?

title: Unit Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (North Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: took about a month  to receive an offer. interview with program director. Overall it was a good interview, not too difficult but it seemed very vague. I believe they mostly promote from within unless you have an exxtensive amount of experience in the field.
Interview Questions: Why do you enjoy working with children?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Pedro, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received a tour of the facility and interacted great with the Director. The interview was very straight forward and conversational. The initial interview was over the phone, then a group setting, and finally with two leaders of the organization. Through out the process, they kept in contact using Indeed and through email.
Interview Questions: How can you make an impact at the Boys & Girls Club?

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Boston, MA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Employees must have a strong interest in working with children, and actively supporting the individual needs of each child. They should be emotionally mature, and willing to commit to the level of service Boys & Girls Club aims to provide. Employees must take pride in all aspects of their designated responsibilities, and be dedicated to further development of their professional skills.
Interview Questions: Basic questions, why do you want to work here? How will you benefit the company?

title: Homework Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Starkville, MS) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed and asked to come in for an interview. The director wanted to learn more about me as a person to see if I would be a good fit around the kids. Didn't take very long.
Interview Questions: If I have experience with kids or teaching.

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone call first.  Behavioral Interview after.  Job offer came after that.  Know what they do to help kids.   Know their formula for impact.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work for them?

title: After School Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Menlo Park, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews.  The first was a phone interview.  The second two were in person interviews.  They had me come up with a lesson plan of my preference and then teach it to them as if they were the students. They also asked questions about what experience I had working in youth development and why I wanted to work in youth development in under-served areas.
Interview Questions: Come up with a lesson plan and teach it to us.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: My online application was answered with three days of submitting. I interviewed with a panel of HR professionals, followed by an interview with the director I would be supporting. The panel interview was pretty standard featuring the questions one would expect. I would recommend preparing for the second interview as the managing interviewer will have some very specific questions.
Interview Questions: How Do you like to be managed? I found it unexpected because I had been my experience that managing top-down was an accepted practice and that direct report preferences was not considered--even if gauging work ethics.

title: Part Time Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Lexington, SC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great. Prior to the interview I told their HR person Mrs Alisha that I had to pick my children up before 6 pm. I was told that the position was from 2-6 pm and if I were chosen that someone from HR would contact me to notify and let me know if they could arrange me leaving by 530 pm. Three days later I was contacted by HR Mrs Hall and told the position was from 2-6 pm and if I could make future arrangements with my kids schedule to please call them back. (Im assuming) I was hired. Three days after that I was told thru my job recruiter that she received a email from the boys and girls HR stating I turned the job down and that they were willing to work with me within my time restraints. The email further stated that they were even willing to allow me to work at the Irmo sc location, which is 30 mins closer to my house. I was originally told the position was only being held for Cayce west Columbia location.  This is quite the opposite of what was explained to me from their HR Mrs Hall. I didn't like looking like a liar or that I declined a job that I went out of my way to interview for I would not want to waste anyone's time. I told my job recruiter I was going to see if the position was still available and see where the descepency was. Upon speaking to HR #1 Mrs Alisha out of only 2 HR staff I was told she did not send any email and that they had filled the position  but were willing to allow me to leave by 530 pm and I should call back in 2 weeks to address my concerns with the HR #2 Mrs Hall and see if any opening. I tried numerous times calling leaving vm with no response. Finally I called HR supervisor Mrs Harper to figure out the descrepencies. After explaining everything she reappointed me to #2 HR Mrs Hall and said she would have her call me directly. 2 hours later #2 HR Mrs Hall called. I explained the inconsistencies with # 1 was I actually hired? #2 will they in fact allow me to work within time restraints? and at the Irmo location? She stated she did not send a email to my recruiter however she in fact was who I originally spoke to. I asked her if she could follow up with my recruiter to notify her that neither she nor HR # 1 Mrs Alisha sent out a email as that would eliminate anything in question.  She replied by nastily stating she didn't care to take the time to clarify anything, that my recruiters email is here say and that my interview had great reviews and the position was still available. She went further to say all locations including Irmo had positions available, as she stated that, a person in the background corrected her telling her  the Cayce area is all they had then and now. So upon learning there were still positions available at any of their locations I reinterated, could they infact do as HR #1 Mrs Alisha said they were willing to, and allow me to work until 530 pm? HR #2 Mrs Hall replied by saying  the position was from 2-6 pm and no one would've told me anything different. I ignitially thought maybe my recruiter misconstrued the email but clearly with their who, what, where , when conflicts and not cross referencing the boys and girls club have a SERIOUS break down in their communication both with future applicants and each other. In Short, There HR staff said completely opposite statements never clarifying any of their contradictive statements nor had any rashional reason to be nasty. If they are this unorthodox how would one even begin to equate procedure, policy etc??????
Interview Questions: If kids got into a scuffle how would you handle it?

title: Childcare Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Providence, RI) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got hired on the spot and the interview process was fairly simple. I first had a brief phone interview and the next day had an in person interview. Asked a few questions about work experience and my schooling. That was about it! Got a job offer on the spot and they decide where they place you (I did this interview for the Providence BGC).
Interview Questions: What is your prior experience in dealing with children in a Daycare setting?

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Arlington, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Walked in very friendly hiring manager. She told me about the job and I got hire on the spot. The process was fast and quick and I was asked about activities I can do
Interview Questions: Tell me about you

title: Program Leaderr Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Cypress, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had already been working on site for another company and was unhappy with that position, and the site supervisor mentioned they were hiring. So, my interview wasn't particularly formal or anything-- I was pretty confident. Still, they asked about my experience working with kids, why I want the job, scheduling stuff, etc.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a tough situation with a kid?

title: Director of Program Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Hilo, HI) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Need someone to run the Boys & Girl Club because previously Director resign and Club was without a Director, the Chief Executive officer was doing the Director position and own position. The programming was not up to standards. The Club need supervision on a daily bases and someone to fill that position as soon as possible.
Interview Questions: Could you manage a schedule

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Statesville, NC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It's a 2 step interview process for full-time employees. You come into your first interview as a round table. There are about 4-5 people who take turns asking different questions. If you get a unanimous vote of yes from the current employees then you are invited in for a second interview as the candidates are narrowed down. The best candidate wins.
Interview Questions: How would you reward a child who has succeeded academically without discouraging the other children who haven't succeeded yet?

title: Teen Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Was called to interview for a position different from the one I applied for.  I spoke with Human Resources on the phone and then had a panel first round interview.  Met with the director for a second round interview.  Human Resources was very quick to follow up after the interviews.
Interview Questions: Lots of situational questions (describe a time when you had to work with a difficult teen, etc) and I was asked to describe my youth development philosophy.

title: Child Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Anchorage, AK) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email back within two days.  The interview was pretty easy, nothing too demanding.  However, I did learn that they were pretty desperate for new hires which speaks a bit about the turnover rate
Interview Questions: What would you do if there is a child off to the side who appears not to be having fun with the majority of the group?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: You have to get a background check, then take a drug test, if you pass this you have to watch a day worth of videos. After that you shadow a counselor and the whole process takes about a week.
Interview Questions: They ask you why you want to work there

title: Computer Lab Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Was initially given a tour of the facility by two Boys & Girls Club members. Interviewed by the Program Director and Unit Director. They were very professional and very specific in their questions regarding experience with technology and working with children.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were very difficult or unexpected. Questions related to technical aptitude, experience working with children and where I saw myself in three (3) years.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard process. Submit a job application and resume to HR. They will call to set up an interview, which involves two people. They ask questions related to the job you're applying for, give scenarios and ask your response, ask about experience and interest in the organization. Nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: Responding to scenario questions would be difficult if you have no experience.

title: Teen Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Loveland, CO) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied on their website, and received an initial interview the following week. It was a very typical interview with different scenarios where I was asked to explain how I would respond in different situations. I was also asked about my previous experience and how I would relate to the kids I would be working with. I was called back for a second interview, which is not until next week.
Interview Questions: This is not a direct quote, but I was asked something like "Since the Teen Program at our center is relatively new and undeveloped, what steps would you take to help grow the program and how would you try to attract more teens in our community to the program? Also, how would you help more teens understand that this program is not just for younger children?"

title: Child Supervision Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Diboll, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went to the facility and filled out a paper application. That same day, i spoke with the director and scheduled an interview that next week. Once I went on the interview I was offered the job on the spot and started that next week. There's no orientation or training or anything.
Interview Questions: How I'm able to deal with certain situations about the kids?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Temecula, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
I called to say that I wanted to volunteer at a site closest to where I live. They immediately introduced me to the Unit Director of the site that best fit my needs and scheduled an interview that best fit my schedule. 

The Interview itself wasn't even hard. It was basic questions about why I wanted to volunteer here and if I'm good with children. No questions to stress over.
Interview Questions: What previous experience have you done that prepared you for a position here?

title: Program Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Scottsdale, AZ) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two full time staff held the interview and one lead and the other wrote down my answers. For the most part it was a typical interview except most of the questions were oriented around your experience with children. The questions are mostly common logic and as long as you don't think harming a child is a good idea of disciplining other peoples children. Then you're pretty much good.
Interview Questions: What is an activity you would run with the kids if you had no time to prepare?

title: Director Organizational Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with recruiter, then panel interview with hiring manager and others.  Recruiter left organization in middle of process - communication from organization stopped.  No coordination with candidates regarding change for communication and/or receipt of materials/info sent to recruiter
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Unit Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Naples, FL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The HR Manager didn't even have the right job description. She thought she was meeting with a part time person for an hourly position. Chaotic experience and felt very unorganized. It was a major red flag as I was interviewing. The offer was presented at that interview, and I was asked to start the next day. It didn't seem like they had very much interest from candidates or needed someone ASAP.
Interview Questions: How well do you cooperate with upper management?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: three rounds - all behavioral based and verification of "fit" - I understood from talking to people that this is a "people" organization and it really helps to know someone there but to also deeply understand the mission.
Interview Questions: Q: What do you know about the mission and BGCA and how does it apply to your background?

title: Recreational Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Long Beach, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't really an interview for me since I volunteered there for a couple of years. But it was pretty basic question asking. Then there was what ifs questions. But, since I volunteered there before I had a foot in the door already so I say volunteer for a couple of months to get experience before hand.
Interview Questions: How do you enjoy working with children?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: The process of getting a job at the camp was to either know someone that works there currently or to be hired through the counselor in training program.
Interview Questions: I never really experienced a formal interview

title: Part Time Seasonal Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I got hired when I was 15, I came to the interview in soccer workout clothes because I had practice right after.  The YDS was very understanding and didn't try to treat me like an adult applying for a very formal position.
Interview Questions: All the questions were difficult, I was 15.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy and simple, sent my resume in and met with hiring team. I interviewed within a few weeks of submitting my resume and got an offer a week later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Long Beach, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy and they made you feel comfortable. They ask questions that let them know your personality and if your a good fit to work with children.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Columbus, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was late.  Asked same questions repeatedly. Seemed uncomfortable and flustered because he was late and I was on time.  Seemed unprofessional.  Informed me that receptionist had also applied for the job.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about travel?

title: Digital Connectors Program Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to them by a hiring company and I was interviewed only once. I was interviewed by a panel of 5 people. They had a list of questions and asking one by one. Most of questions were from background knowledge and experience and I did good on that.
Interview Questions: There was a question asking about what you have done to improve the process in your previous jobs.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Utica, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal interview. I applied for a position as a program director and was given a job offer. I later found out that the position was not open and had to accept a position as a group  leader.
Interview Questions: The interview was very informal.

title: Activities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Escondido, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They emailed me right away for an interview, and it was an overall positive experience. I felt like they wanted to ask me a lot of questions that were related to the job, but they also wanted to know what drew me to the company and the position.
Interview Questions: What is another application for a pencil, besides writing.

title: Front Desk Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Stuart, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview of five employees; asked straight forward questions. One exercise in the interview consisted of creating a quick activity to see if you can handle "going with the flow".
Interview Questions: What are the values of the company?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was asked the general questions that you are asked within a interview.  My opinion is that they already knew that they were not going to hire me because they did not even allow me to know about the job opening that had become available.  I had to go online and find out about it, after asking the head staff.
Interview Questions: If any, what are somethings that you have accomplished while here so far?

title: PE Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Branch Manager and they asked me a series of questions based on my experience and past volunteer opportunities. It was an easy interview and it was great to get to know the branch manager
Interview Questions: What has been the most challenging thing about working with kids

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume based on a craigslist posting. Got a call back, interviewed with CFO, then with president, CFO, and HR manager.
Interview Questions: they were all pretty basic questions.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Santa Monica, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Usual questions.  Apparently there has been a great deal of turn over in this particular department.  The approach to acquiring new donors is through direct mail (very expensive).  Staff is not allowed to talk with and/or meet with Board.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Riverside, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was notified by phone calls and  Emails, reported to a school to meet with a supervisor interviewed, paper application, once accepted sent for a physical as well as a drug test and TB test.
Interview Questions: How many children per classroom could you handle.

title: Youth Guidance Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Williams Lake, BC) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Employer asked general questions about ethics and values that I had, making sure they matched up with theirs. Gave hypothetical scenarios and asked how you would respond to them
Interview Questions: If "Sally" (a youth or child at the centre) asked you to go to her house for a pool party, what would you say?

title: Aquatic Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was three rounds of interviews where I met different people in the organization. The people interviewing me seemed to care significantly about the organization. However the interview was very lay back and easy going. I felt like I was a member of the organization even before I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Child Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Globe, AZ) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: very thorough, average and very reasonable, interesting, educational, motivating, it was very different, and I was a little scared that the children wouldn't like me in my trial work day
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids

title: Camp Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Brampton, ON) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long process. Questions were suitable for the job. But the interviewers had poor communication, and interpersonal skills. Very sarcastic and rude in their approach. If you are applying to this job I don't recommend it if you are looking for a good pay or proper training. They we're suppose to provide first aid training to staff and behavioural training and until this day they haven't done so. They are very behind.
Interview Questions: What motivates you.

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Lowell, MA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Director and he was great. I was extremely nervous but he saw through that and saw my passion for working with children. He even helped me during the group interview, he invited me to. In the three panel group interiew, it was good cod/bad cop style but I was comfortable and confident.
Interview Questions: How would I be an assect to the team?

title: Youth Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Mead, WA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple. Met with the person who ran the club asked me simple questions and my experience which I had none. She was very helpful and just looking for energetic and helpful staff members who could make things run smoothly.
Interview Questions: What is your experience?

title: Unit Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Jackson, TN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online and was called in for interview. Meet with Executive Director ask questions about history of club and experience working with children.  Ask about qualifications such as degrees and experience in working for non profit organization
Interview Questions:
What do you know about the organization?
Do you have previous experience working with children?
Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years?

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Columbus, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The company completes a long background check of course because your working with kids. Once its complete you have three interviews you have to do. After you're hired, you are to shadow a staff for 1 or 2 days.  Then you're put to the test to see if you can work with the kids. Once they see you are a good fit with working with kids your good to go.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the boys and girls club?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called back very quickly. I went in for an interview two days later and was interviewed by three people. The questions were pretty easy and just asked about past experiences, why I applied there, what are my career goals, etc. The interviewers were unorganized and didn't know what they were doing.
Interview Questions: How would you make a game of basketball fun

title: Chief Information Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online. I received a telephone interview request within a few days of applying. The interview was supposed to be an hour long but thirty minutes in to the interview I was told I could continue with the phone interview or that she could send me an email to have me answer the rest of the questions. I was taken aback by this sudden change since we hadn't really discussed my qualifications or the details of the position but I could tell she was ready to get of the phone. When I called back to ask if I needed to complete the questions I had already answered I was told that they already had everything they needed and didn't need to answer any additional questions. I would consider the interviewer to be rude and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: I never got to the question and answer session of the interview.

title: Education Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (North Knoxville, TN) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in for an interview with the club director and was told I was overqualified. Two weeks passed and I was invited for an interview with HR and two other senior admin.  This interview lasted about an hour.  I was contacted 1.5 weeks after that and offered a part-time position and non-negotiable salary ($12/hr).  I then had to have a background check and urine drug test.  When those came back clean I was told I had to wait for a training period to open up.  This took 1.5 weeks.  In total I waited just over a month from initial interview to start process.  I had to wait an additional two weeks for my first paycheck.
Interview Questions: What would you do to improve educational buy-in at X club?

title: Activity Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Bakersfield, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was really friendly and easy. They want to hire people ready to be a good role model for kids and it shows within the interview process. One question I was asked was, "how would you settle a disagreement between conflicting students?".
Interview Questions: How would you settle disagreement between conflicting students?

title: Van Driver/Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: got called up and was interviewed by 2 people within the next few days. has been a week and a half and still no call back.
Interview Questions: What would you do to get the attention of a group of children?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was a group interview, really layed back, and great experience. The managers were very nice and the administrators where sweet as well. They do a background investigation as well as drug test.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work with children?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Tedious and slow.  Phone interview with HR assistant- very scripted.  Followed by second phone interview with HR (recruiter).  in person interview with a panel of 3 including the hiring manager.  All behavioral questions with next to no questions that elicit my real ability to do the job.  weeks after interview to get offer together.  Also had to write a letter.  Really basic, silly for a job at the level I was interviewing.  Makes you realize the caliber of typical applicant if this was a critical part of the interview process.
Interview Questions: Dont recall exact questions but all behavioral. What would you do in "x" situation; tell me about a time that you had to do "x"

title: Recreation Area Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Interview Descriptions: Applied through a craigslist ad and then received a phone call a couple days later and scheduled and interview at the site. Had a one and one interview in a back room. A couple days later received a phone call to schedule a second interview. Second interview consisted of the person from the first interview and a new person.
Interview Questions: Would you rather be respected or liked?

title: After School Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an ad on Craigslist and received an invitation to interview within a week.  I was asked to show up with a my resume and a list of activities I would consider leading with the children.  I interviewed with the Child Care Director and the teacher with whom I would be working.  It was very laid back.  They asked basic questions about my previous experience and why I wanted to work with kids.  They also shared stories about the kids they worked with, giving me a good idea of what to expect on the job.  At the end, I was invited back for a working interview so that they could evaluate how I interacted or "clicked" with the kids.
Interview Questions: All questions were pretty basic.  They gave scenarios that were a little trick to answer because I didn't know their policies.  "Pretend you are serving the kids snack (family style) and one kid begins to complain and make a scene saying that somebody got an unfair amount.  How would you react to or diffuse the situation?"

title: Youth Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was a phone pre-screening. Then I was set up for in person interview went well , after which I was scheduled for 2nd interview which was short and sweet offered posltion.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Boys and Girls Club

title: Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Austin, TX) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: My interview was a very typical one-on-one conversation with the person who became my direct supervisor. We talked about past work experience, my level of comfort with different age ranges in the classroom. I think I had to answer some of the questions in Spanish, since it was a bilingual position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Boys and Girls Clubs?

title: Site Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: They will asked you about how you handle stressful situations. A lot of common sense. They want to make sure you can handle a location on your own. This means programming for the kids and great communication with parents other staff and the community. They ask a lot about you past experience. They dont want this to be your first site supervisor job. They want someone proven capable of handling the challenges.
Interview Questions: How many dogs do you have?

title: Event Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Marlborough, MA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and face to face interview plus tour of the club house/offices. I learned of the job opportunity through my school and networked through that. I reached out to the club to the contact I had and expressed interest in setting up an internship over the summer.
Interview Questions: What experiences will you bring to this internship?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Washington, DC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Fairly Easy. 
Went to the Boys & Girls Club and heard about the process in becoming a camp worker for the summer of 2012. Did a few preparation class at the club to get referrals in to the camp program. The program was about the Youth Program of Washington DC, so the process was legit. Went to an Interview location once called or emailed back. Since I went to the Interview  location I did not have to do another interview. Long Day but it was worth it.
Interview Questions: How do you handle children who are shy?

title: Program Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Clemente, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I started as a temporary hire for a summer program.  I stood out among the other temps and was offered a job throughout the year.  For the most part the interviews consisted of an in person interview that lasted about 30 minutes.  From there you advance to a light background check and driving record check.  If you get through those two steps you will get an in person offer.
Interview Questions:
What are your interests?
What are your educational aspirations?
Why are you a good role model?

title: Grants Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a job with B&GC online, and was called for an interview.  I arrived 15 minutes early to fill out paperwork, as instructed and was presented with a paper application identical to the one I filled out online.  My interview was scheduled for 11a, and they kept me waiting until 11:45a.  The environment was very cold and sterile.  The interview panel was stiff and not at all engaging.  They kept referencing how the job is very process driven but all the questions were behavioral "how would you handle this awful situation" questions.  After the interview, I was taken into another room by a really superficial and phony woman who proceeded to tell me about their benefits, touting "free parking" as their signature item.  Standard medical benefits, but the vacation benefit is structured funny.  I didn't get the sense they were really receptive to my questions about work life balance, professional development and advancement opportunities.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would handle an irate funder calling about an issue with a grant?

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Trenton, NJ) in Apr 2012
