Interview Descriptions: They were very detailed. I felt like they genuinely cared about providing the best services to the members. I put in an application on April 2, 2012. I had an interview on April 16, 2012 and was hired the same day.
Interview Questions: All questions are based around following childcare and NJ After 3 guidelines.

title: Activities Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Portland, OR) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I responded to a Craigslist ad and got a call within a week or two. Initial interview was just a basic screening that didn't last long & a tour of the facility. Was called later that day for a second interview, scheduled the following day. 2nd interview wasn't much, just talked about the job and what my interests were. They were very accommodating and let me pick my club location and which part of the club I'd work in. The following week I had to pass a background check, drug test, and reference check. They asked for 4-5 references but only needed to hear from 3.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in 3 positive words.

title: Federal Work Study Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was ask simple question majorly about how I considered managing. Was also ask about my career experience with children and how long I been ins child care service. Its really your basic interview.
Interview Questions: If you had an unruly parent asking about a situation about their child and you just got inside the job and about to do your shift what would you do?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Solana Beach, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and great hiring process. Got back to me quickly and promptly.
Interview Questions: There really was none, very straight forward

title: English Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Arecibo, PR) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was brief .They asked questions about how would I work with different situations with kids.I answered to my knowledge.They liked my answers.Got hired.Worked seven years.I stared off as a tutor and ended as a programs assistant.
Interview Questions: How would you teach a child with learning disabilities?

title: Recreation Area Supervisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Jasper, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was first interviewed by the District Director. I was asked questions from a list of predefined questions. They wanted to know why I would want to work with children, about situations in past jobs, my ability to discipline appropriately, and how I would view the ideal staff-child relationship. I was then called back for an interview with the Club Director, using the same questions. The next day I was called and hired on.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to discipline a child.

title: Recreation Area Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Good interview experience. Was very professional. Impressed with the level of attention to detail. Really was impressed on a scale of 1 to 10, definitely was a 10 out of 10. Great experience overall. Would definitely recommend others to interview and apply to this employer. In all my job interviews I would rank this my favorite and best of all-time interviews. I felt really proud to be able to work for such a great company that has a great cause.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Fairview, TN) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the club director. He asked me  a lot of basic questions regarding my experience and why I wanted to work there. Then you're given a lot of hypothetical scenarios and asked how you would react to them.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation in managing a classroom.

title: Teen Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process began when I eneterd the center seeking employment. I was greeted by an assistant who directed me to the dircetor of the entire center. At the time the dircector was busy on a call so i waited. Once I had the chance I introduced myself stated my business and presented a resume. The dircetor set a interview for the next day. At first there was a phone interview than there was a 2:1 interview with both the Director and Assistant director. After that I was offered the position pending the background check. The interview was very lax so much so that the director was eating lunch and check messages on their cell phone.
Interview Questions: Do you have a signifcant other who may interfere with your work performance?

title: Site Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: initially, the company seemed very professional in regards to corresponding through email, phone, etc.  After the first (of THREE) interviews, the descriptions and information given of the job were sounding less and less like the actual job description and more like a 24 hour, 7 days a week type of 'commitment'.  The offer was ridiculously low considering all the responsibilities and time involved - almost insulting.
Interview Questions: Why you, why here?

title: Senior Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (New York, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I knew someone who worked at the site. Gave me a referral and within a week I got called in for an interview. Basic interview questions and some geared towards working with children. Very easy and straight forward interview.
Interview Questions: why would you like to work for this organization?

title: Teen Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Malibu, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Casual sit down with Program Director, very friendly yet professional! Asked straightforward questions about my background, interest in education and working with children. Also laid out some of the daily responsibilities of BGC staff and what to expect. 

Very welcoming atmosphere, gave a tour of the premises, and very open to any and all questions.
Interview Questions:
What made you interested in the Boys and Girls Club? 
Have you had experience working with kids?

title: Homework Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Wilmington, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: As a previous student I was hired upon reliability and frequent work while in highschool. I was given the chance to be hired without interview, but as the interview process goes, there are specific character traits that the Boys and Girls clubs requires, and that is of a patient, loving, and caring nature. If you cannot socialize well with young people and do not have self discipline then this is not the job for you.
Interview Questions: What can you do to make a change in a kids life.

title: Academic Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume and cover letter to the HR director, and she got back to me promptly to schedule an interview.  I applied in September, right before the beginning of the 2011-2012 school year, and the turn around rate for applicants is quickest then because they have positions that need to be filled immediately.  The interview was held in a conference room, where I was interviewed by 3 directors at once.  They went down a list of 10 questions or so, asking about my former experience with children, academic background, personal hobbies I would be interested in teaching as an elective if hired as a mentor, and which grade I would most like to teach. The interview lasted less than a hour and I was hired on the spot.  The office environment is very casual, low budget, and everyone seems to have a well-rounded sense of humor.
Interview Questions: What electives would you like to teach, if hired?

title: Recreation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Homer, AK) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. My director was friendly and you can tell that she was passionate for the children. Really positive engagement about the reason of applying for the job. Able to see the working environment to gain a great perspective and clearly explanation of the job expectation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids? How would you handle trouble kids in difficult situations?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Denver, CO) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Three day process. Multiple interviews with targeted committees over three days. Also business social on third day with final three applicants. Interviews use Situation or Task Action result format. They describe a situation or task and you tell when you have experienced the example, what you did and the results.
Interview Questions: When in the past have you submitted a program for grant funding?

title: Art Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Worcester, MA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: One day I was driving by the Boys and Girls Club in my area and I stopped in and asked if they had a need for an Arts and Crafts instructor. The answer was yes and I met with the director of one of the local clubs. We discussed my ideas and I was hired.
Interview Questions: What are you expecting for an hourly wage?

title: Child Care Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Chandler, AZ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with boss for short informal interview and got the job a week later.
Interview Questions: What is your extensive experience with children?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Diego, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The Site leader sat down with me and asked several questions regarding child development and past experience with working with children.  Several questions alluded to possible scenarios that occur on a regular basis and how the applicant would handle the situation.  Manager was very friendly throughout the whole process.  For this particular interview the applicant had to sing a mock song, as songs are a daily occurrence.  A very funny, healthy and positive interview.
Interview Questions:
What would you do in this situation:

Two children are fighting, you turn around to look at another situation and when you return one child is holding their nose?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was simple. Had a quick phone interview then an in person interview and tour of the building. Quickly got acclimated to the office and all of the staff.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Youth Development Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy . they hire a lot and they like college students who are willing to work a lot for little pay. They take forever to get back to you know and then the hiring process takes a while. You must also submit background check, tb test, and drug test
Interview Questions: why you want to work for them

title: Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Houston, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The only advice I could give would be to ensure more complete understanding of the responsibilities involved and the follow up process if those goals are not being met along the way. Lay out how those steps will be implemented as part of a review process.
Interview Questions: Why are you here? Why did you [leave] your last job?

title: Youth Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Boerne, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to Unit Director on the phone and scheduled a 1:1 interview.  In the interview she toured me through the establishment and explained what occurred in each room.  She was pretty detailed and very nice.  A background check and detailed application were completed.  The application included unique questions like what you would do in different situations.  I was hired and started in two days.
Interview Questions: How well do you handle a group of children?

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was so long ago I don't remember many of the details. The process was quite standard and they didn't ask any weird, out side of the box type of questions. The interviewer was pleasant and didn't make me feel on the spot.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Unit Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (North Chicago, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Currently employed, emailed resume and filled out application for B&GC anyway. I received an email offering a phone interview. Interview took place the following day. The interview was rather short, not quite sure what to expect. Hoping for the best. Asked me to explain a time when I had to discipline a child; how many staff have I managed; how many children I supervised by myself; and the last question, what makes a program successful.
Interview Questions: To reiterate: How many children have I supervised alone?

title: Chief Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The Local board conducted the interview. First with interview committee, then full board after the final cut. They narrowed the 20 applicants to 5 interviews and selected the final candidate from there.
Interview Questions: How will you raise reliable funding sources that will be ongoing?

title: Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Long Beach, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: asked questions for the strengths that you have with the kids and also they ask you questions on how you would deal with problems and arguments between the students as well as how you would you structure your day in the classroom with the students and what you want to show the students for lessons and activities and how would you impact the life of a student
Interview Questions: how would you deal with two students who are fighting over a chair?

title: Chief Operations Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I initially submitted my resume in person.  Within 1 week of applying I recieved a call to interview with the CEO.  It was my personal opinion that the interview went really well. The CEO stated that I would recieve a call for a 2nd interview; unfortunately that never occured.

Overall it was a good expereince for me and the culture of the office appeared to be a good fit for me.
Interview Questions: How many people have you supervised

title: Branch Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Glendale, AZ) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Normal interview and called to confirm I was hired.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: After School Extension Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Cypress, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I saw the posting online, emailed my resume, and received a call to come in for an interview a week later. The interview was very informal...I met with the program director. She told me a lot about the program and only asked me a few questions. Pretty basic stuff...can you discipline kids, what experience do you have working with kids, etc. She said I should hear from her by the end of the week.
Interview Questions: Do you think you can handle disciplining a group of kids?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview and received a call back for a 1:1 interview with a manager.  The same day of the 1:1 I received a call to interview with the COO at a later date.  I interviewed with the COO and received a rejection email two day later.
Interview Questions: Does you current employer know that you are seeking other employment.

title: Youth Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: E-mailed resume to area director and the next day got a phone call to schedule an interview. I met with the area director, director of program operations and two club directors. It was an easy interview, they put you at ease. It consisted of about 10 questions and each question asked was worth up to 10 points. The first questions were basic like why the B&GC, do you have experience working with kids, etc. Then there was a series of scenario questions. After the interview I got a call a couple of days later and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: What type of qualities do you have that would make you a great asset to the Boys and Girls Club?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was initially called by the recruiter as well as the sr director of the program. I met for a 1:1 interview with him and one other member of his staff and after that discussion recieved word from the recruiter they decided to move in another direction with other candidates.
Interview Questions: Please explain a problem in which you were a chnage agent?

title: Grants & Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Milpitas, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was done at the administrative offices.  The panel was prepared with appropriate questions and I was given sufficient time to answer them.  The panel was friendly and open about the organization and I learned a lot about how it operates, which gave me an opportunity to evaluate how it would be working there.
Interview Questions: What was my previous experience working with foundations and how did I develop the relationships to advance my position in obtaining grants?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, conducted initial phone screening and had in-person panel interview with hiring manager and two other employees.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to lead but were not given the authority

title: Manager, Programs and Business Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Ottawa, ON) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very good process and warm staff. I never felt that it was unorganized. The only issue was that the position itself was undefined and the collective organization did not necessarily approve of it. Obviously I found out about this AFTER.
Interview Questions: What is something that you could work on?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Tacoma, WA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: when in with a friend that had been working there and applied right there. I have an interview that day, and within a week i was working. I had to go through a background, drug test. I had worked at the boys and girls club before several years before. The interview process for me was brief and straight forward.
Interview Questions: what would you do in this situation?

title: Staff Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Boston, MA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very positive, and easy going process. People were friendly, quick, and overachieving.
Interview Questions: If you could have dinner with any 3 people either dead or alive, who would you choose and why?

title: Youth Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: This was a group interview and very interactive.  We had to play games and compete with one another.  They wanted to see how enthusiastic we were and how we interacted with others.  We also had to create an art object and then present it to the entire group.  We then had a 1:1 with the supervisor with the basic interview questions...nothing all that difficult.
Interview Questions: When have you felt out of control and how did you deal with it

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was referred from a previous position at another BGC
Interview Questions: I t was pretty standard

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Troy, NY) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professional. I met with the Site Director first and she asked me basic interview questions. Then I met with the Executive Director and she asked me questions that the staff and assembled together.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation with a parent.

title: Unit Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Everything was pretty basic.  They asked the typical questions that you would expect in an interview like this.  They are most interested in finding out about your previous experience.  Some of the questions are repetitive and I got the feeling that they were looking for consistency.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Saint John's, NL) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I received an interview because I have been volunteering at the club all year.
The interview was more difficult than I expected.  There were two supervisors and they taped the answers I gave so they could review them later and I thought that was a great idea.
They asked me scenerios questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do if an irrate parent came in screaming that one of the kids threw a stone at their car.

title: Teen Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions:
The Boys and Girls club was the interview to prepare me for all other interviews.

1. I applied for the job using their website (which is almost never updated)
2. I was scheduled for a phone interview for a position that was lower than I originally applied for.  I was never consulted if I wanted the position (I was unemployed, I wanted it).
3. The first interview was a 45+ minute phone interview asking at least 25 behavioral questions. 
IE "Tell me about a time you made a mistake.  Tell me how you handled that mistake.  Tell me about a time your supervisor had to discipline you.  Tell me about a success story with someone you worked with.  Tell me about the hardest decision you had to make..." 
3. I passed the initial screening and was schedule for a group interview at the job location.  I was interviewed by 5 males and I was asked additional behavioral questions and odd questions to prove that I could work with under-served teens. "I am going to give you a list of slang words, tell me what they mean..."
4. I was told to prepare an activity to present to the teens as part of the interview process.  Unfortunately, do to scheduling conflicts, I didn't get a chance to present.

The job was working with teens in a dangerous neighborhood (Visitation Valley).  

I was declined the next day!
Interview Questions: Tell me about....(every difficult or successful situation you have ever been involved with during your career)

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: comfortable, open interview with questions about my feelings and views concerning urban non-profits,. People were friendly, accepting and willing to help you get acclimated to the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys & Girls Clubs of America (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions that look for independence and leadership qualities.  Also questions asking how I would handle hypothetical situations, such as ideas for games, activities, etc.  I would also mention that there was no drug test, which I thought was odd.
Interview Questions: What are some games you would play with the children.
